summary: This chapter emphasizes the importance of identifying and closing the gaps in your team's work responsibilities. By understanding your complementary skills and the reliance of others on your expertise, you can prioritize tasks that require attention. It encourages an audit of current work relationships and responsibilities to determine what can be delegated. The chapter provides a systematic approach to categorizing tasks into easily addressable items and those that require significant investment. This ongoing process can enhance both personal growth and organizational resilience.

slides.section_title: Understanding Your Role in the Team's Success
slides.section_body: To effectively support your team, it's crucial to recognize the areas where your skills complement their efforts. Reflect on how your expertise helps others and what they rely on you for, whether it's authorization, technical advice, or organizational navigation.
slides.quote: Understand the unique value you bring to your team.

slides.section_title: Conducting an Audit of Tasks and Requests
slides.section_body: Review inbound communications like chats and emails to extract requests and questions directed your way. This audit is fundamental to pinpointing your responsibilities and identifying areas for delegation.
slides.quote: An audit reveals hidden opportunities for empowerment.

slides.section_body: Examine the work you've completed in the past six months, as well as any tasks you've postponed. This reflection helps clarify your current workload and exposes potential gaps.
slides.quote: Your past work can illuminate paths for future growth.

slides.section_body: Consider the external relationships that have played a vital role in your position. Identifying key strategic partners is essential for navigating organizational challenges and leveraging additional support.
Once you've compiled a list of gaps, test your findings against colleagues to ensure nothing has been overlooked. Collaborative input can unveil additional areas for improvement and development.
slides.quote: Collaboration uncovers insights that lead to breakthroughs.

slides.section_body: For every item on your list, identify individuals who could take on these responsibilities. This exercise helps prioritize tasks and empowers others within your organization.
slides.quote: Delegation nurtures growth in others and yourself.

slides.section_body: Categorize the gaps into those that are easy to close and those that are more complex. Recognizing and addressing the simplest tasks first can lead to impactful changes quickly.
slides.quote: Tackling simple tasks can yield significant results.

slides.section_body: Create a plan to address not only the easier gaps but also the more complicated ones that require your unique skills. This proactive approach ensures sustained progress towards efficiency.
slides.quote: Planning is the bridge between intent and achievement.

slides.section_body: This exercise is not a one-time process; running it annually helps you continuously identify delegable tasks and improve team dynamics. Adapting to such practices nurtures an enduring organization.
slides.quote: Continuous evaluation cultivates resilience in leadership.

slides.section_body: Taking strategic breaks can reveal overlooked responsibilities. Use this insight for future planning and to foster personal growth in your leadership journey.
slides.quote: Every time you pause, your role can redefine.
